settings.blog-title: WHAT TO WEAR TO WORK IN THE SUMMER

settings.text: Dressing for scorching temperatures on holiday is a breeze, but heading into an office can often complicate matters. To help you dress appropriately and maintain your flawless style whatever the weather, we present our seven summer workwear must-haves...

settings.grid-content:
1. A white shirt

A staple piece in any office wardrobe, the classic white shirt is so versatile you will reach for it time and again. Not only flexible in what it can be matched with, it’s also suited to year-round wear. Pair it with a chic suit, or with a brightly coloured midi skirt if your workplace is more relaxed. For a true embodiment of summer, opt for a billowy style that can be tucked into tailored trousers or jeans, depending on your evening plans.

2. A tailored jumpsuit

Not only suited to evenings out, a tailored jumpsuit may seem like an obvious addition to your workwear wardrobe, yet it is often overlooked. A saviour on those rushed mornings where nothing seems to go to plan, simply throw it on and only concern yourself with the perfect shoes and accessories. If you have more on your agenda than work, a jumpsuit is an easy way to transition from boardroom to bar. Simply switch your sneakers for heeled sandals when you leave your desk behind.

settings.text:
How were you introduced to Chinti & Parker and why is the brand such a good fit for Women for Women International?

We’ve been working with Chinti & Parker since 2018, when the brand launched a collection in aid of Women for Women International. I love the fact that the brand is the brainchild of two women, Anna and Rachael, who have an inherent understanding of what women want to feel and look good in. This is so reflective of the women who go through our programme. Many of them become successful entrepreneurs or work together in embroidery / craft cooperatives.

settings.grid-content:
3. High waisted, cropped trousers

Cropped, wide-legged trousers often make for more relaxed working attire than cigarette styles. Pair yours with a floaty blouse tucked in or even a basic T-shirt if the sun is blazing overhead. The perfect shoe? Loafers

4. A midi skirt

Statement or staple, however you perceive the midi skirts in your wardrobe, there’s no denying that they are perfect summer office attire. For a playful pairing, complement a printed skirt with a colour-block tee or a slogan cashmere jumper on slightly cooler days and evenings.

5. Jeans

Denim is never off limits in the modern workplace. Swap out winter jeans in shades of indigo, grey and black for lighter washes, pastels or printed finishes. A crisp white blouse keeps things easy. Dress up from there with statement accessories.

6. A shoulder bag

A summer work bag should accomplish two goals: look great and be easy to carry. You want it roomy enough to house your daily essentials - phone, wallet, SPF, makeup bag, etc. - but not so large that it weighs you down. That’s what makes a trusty shoulder bag so appealing.

7. Statement jewellery

The right jewels can elevate even the most casual of looks. If you’re opting for a basic T-shirt or blouse, this season’s colourful beaded necklaces are the perfect accompaniment. When the weather heats up, it’s natural to pull long hair back into a sleek ponytail; in this case, statement earrings might be your accessory of choice.

8. A cotton sweater

Let’s face it, summer can be unpredictable. However, lightweight layers make dressing for tricky forecasts that little bit easier. For versatility, choose a cotton jumper that you can slip on with jeans or over a lightweight dress. Perfect for protecting you from overzealous air conditioning or an evening chill when dining outside, cotton knitwear is at once lightweight, breathable and warm.
